Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and streaky black below; dot rosette in added white with added red centre; exterior: around rim, band of solid tongues with outline; below, band of dash and billet pattern; below on left, pendant corner filling ornament; on right, vertical dividing band of paired hook maeander in between band of chequers with dotted blanks.
Curator's comments: The sherd ought to belong to the end of the period of the Wild Goat Style since, although the metopal pattern decoration on the exterior surface is typical of the Wild Goat Style, the lotus decoration on the interior, which is absent during this period, is typical in the later reserved Mature Animal Style. Furthermore, the heavy chalice does not typically appear as early as in the Wild Goat Style, but the thickness and diameter of this sherd suggest that it comes from a vessel much larger than a chalice. Perhaps this sherd marks the transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1524) (phase 2)
